1use crate::{
2	input::{InputFile, Scope, TargetType},
3	links::Links
4};
5use itertools::Itertools as _;
6use log::debug;
7use pulldown_cmark::{
8	BrokenLink, CodeBlockKind, CowStr, Event, HeadingLevel, LinkType, Options, Parser,
9	Tag, TagEnd
10};
11use semver::Version;
12use serde::Serialize;
13use std::{collections::BTreeMap, fmt::Write as _, io};
14use syn::Path;
15use url::Url;
16
17const DEFAULT_CODEBLOCK_LANG: &str = "rust";
18/// List of codeblock flags that rustdoc allows
19const RUSTDOC_CODEBLOCK_FLAGS: &[&str] = &[
20	"compile_fail",
21	"edition2015",
22	"edition2018",
23	"edition2021",
24	"edition2024",
25	"ignore",
26	"no_run",
27	"should_panic"
28];
29const RUSTDOC_CODEBLOCK_PREFIXES: &[&str] = &["ignore-"];
30
31pub struct ResolvedLink {
32	pub path: String,
33	pub link_type: Option<crate::input::LinkType>
34}
35
36impl Scope {
37	pub fn resolve(&self, crate_name: &str, path: String) -> ResolvedLink {
38		self.resolve_impl(crate_name, None, path)
39	}
40
41	pub fn resolve_impl(
42		&self,
43		crate_name: &str,
44		link_type: Option<crate::input::LinkType>,
45		path: String
46	) -> ResolvedLink {
47		if !path.starts_with("::") {
48			// split path into segments, ignoring <...> generics
49			let mut path = path.clone();
50			loop {
51				let idx = match (path.find('<'), path.rfind('>')) {
52					(Some(idx1), Some(idx2)) if idx1 < idx2 => idx1,
53					_ => break
54				};
55				let mut end = idx + 1;
56				let mut depth: usize = 1;
57				for ch in path[end ..].chars() {
58					if ch == '<' {
59						depth += 1;
60					} else if ch == '>' {
61						depth -= 1;
62					}
63					end += ch.len_utf8();
64
65					if depth == 0 {
66						break;
67					}
68				}
69				path.replace_range(idx .. end, "");
70			}
71			debug!("Resolving path {path:?}");
72			let mut segments = path.split("::").collect::<Vec<_>>();
73			if segments[0] == "crate" {
74				segments[0] = crate_name;
75			}
76
77			// check if we can resolve anything
78			if self.scope.contains_key(segments[0]) {
79				let paths = &self.scope[segments[0]];
80				if let Some((path_link_type, path)) = paths.front() {
81					segments[0] = path;
82					let path = segments.join("::");
83					if path.starts_with("::") {
84						return ResolvedLink {
85							path,
86							link_type: if segments.len() == 1 {
87								Some(*path_link_type)
88							} else {
89								link_type
90							}
91						};
92					}
93					return self.resolve(crate_name, segments.join("::"));
94				}
95			}
96		}
97
98		ResolvedLink { path, link_type }
99	}
100}
101
102fn broken_link_callback<'a>(lnk: BrokenLink<'_>) -> Option<(CowStr<'a>, CowStr<'a>)> {
103	Some(("".into(), lnk.reference.to_string().into()))
104}
105
106fn filter_hidden_rust_codeblock_lines(line: &str) -> Option<&str> {
107	match line.strip_prefix('#') {
108		Some(stripped_line) => match stripped_line.chars().next() {
109			// ignore "#" lines
110			None => None,
111			// replace "##" at the start of a line with "#"
112			Some('#') => Some(stripped_line),
113			// ignore lines starting with "#" if it is followed by whitespace
114			Some(c) if c.is_whitespace() => None,
115			// don't ignore the line if the "#" isn't followed by whitespace
116			Some(_) => Some(line)
117		},
118		None => Some(line)
119	}
120}
121
122struct EventFilter<'a, I: Iterator<Item = Event<'a>>> {
123	iter: I,
124	links: &'a mut BTreeMap<String, String>,
125
126	in_code_block: bool,
127	in_rust_code_block: bool,
128	link_idx: usize
129}
130
131impl<'a, I: Iterator<Item = Event<'a>>> EventFilter<'a, I> {
132	fn new(iter: I, links: &'a mut BTreeMap<String, String>) -> Self {
133		Self {
134			iter,
135			links,
136
137			in_code_block: false,
138			in_rust_code_block: false,
139			link_idx: 0
140		}
141	}
142}
143
144impl<'a, I: Iterator<Item = Event<'a>>> Iterator for EventFilter<'a, I> {
145	type Item = Event<'a>;
146
147	fn next(&mut self) -> Option<Self::Item> {
148		loop {
149			break Some(match self.iter.next()? {
150				Event::Start(tag) => Event::Start(match tag {
151					// we increase headings by 1 level
152					Tag::Heading {
153						level,
154						id,
155						classes,
156						attrs
157					} => {
158						let level = match level {
159							HeadingLevel::H1 => HeadingLevel::H2,
160							HeadingLevel::H2 => HeadingLevel::H3,
161							HeadingLevel::H3 => HeadingLevel::H4,
162							HeadingLevel::H4 => HeadingLevel::H5,
163							_ => HeadingLevel::H6
164						};
165						Tag::Heading {
166							level,
167							id,
168							classes,
169							attrs
170						}
171					},
172
173					// we record codeblocks and adjust their language
174					Tag::CodeBlock(kind) => {
175						debug_assert!(
176							!self.in_code_block,
177							"Recursive codeblocks, wtf???"
178						);
179						self.in_code_block = true;
180						Tag::CodeBlock(CodeBlockKind::Fenced(match kind {
181							CodeBlockKind::Indented => DEFAULT_CODEBLOCK_LANG.into(),
182							CodeBlockKind::Fenced(lang) => {
183								let mut lang: String = (*lang).to_owned();
184								for prefix in RUSTDOC_CODEBLOCK_PREFIXES {
185									while let Some(idx_start) = lang.find(prefix) {
186										let idx_off = idx_start + prefix.len();
187										match lang[idx_off ..].find(',') {
188											Some(idx_end) => lang.replace_range(
189												idx_start ..= idx_off + idx_end,
190												""
191											),
192											None => lang.replace_range(idx_start .., "")
193										}
194									}
195								}
196								for flag in RUSTDOC_CODEBLOCK_FLAGS {
197									lang = lang.replace(flag, "");
198								}
199								let mut lang: CowStr<'_> = lang.replace(',', "").into();
200								if lang.is_empty() {
201									lang = DEFAULT_CODEBLOCK_LANG.into();
202								}
203								self.in_rust_code_block =
204									&*lang == DEFAULT_CODEBLOCK_LANG;
205								lang
206							}
207						}))
208					},
209
210					Tag::Link {
211						link_type,
212						dest_url,
213						title,
214						id
215					} if dest_url.starts_with('#')
216						|| link_type == LinkType::Autolink
217						|| link_type == LinkType::Email =>
218					{
219						Tag::Link {
220							link_type,
221							dest_url,
222							title,
223							id
224						}
225					},
226					Tag::Link {
227						dest_url,
228						title,
229						id,
230						link_type
231					} => {
232						let link = format!("__link{}", self.link_idx);
233						self.link_idx += 1;
234						if !dest_url.is_empty() {
235							self.links.insert(link.clone(), dest_url.to_string());
236						} else if !id.is_empty() {
237							self.links.insert(link.clone(), id.to_string());
238						} else if !title.is_empty() {
239							self.links.insert(link.clone(), title.to_string());
240						} else {
241							break Some(Event::Start(Tag::Link {
242								link_type,
243								dest_url,
244								title,
245								id
246							}));
247						}
248						Tag::Link {
249							// pulldown-cmark-to-cmark does not support outputting
250							// unresolved reference-style links so we have to do
251							// it this stupid way
252							link_type: LinkType::Inline,
253							dest_url: link.into(),
254							title: "".into(),
255							id
256						}
257					},
258
259					// we don't need to modify any other tags
260					tag => tag
261				}),
262
263				Event::End(tag) => Event::End(match tag {
264					// we record when a codeblock ends
265					TagEnd::CodeBlock => {
266						debug_assert!(
267							self.in_code_block,
268							"Ending non-started code block, wtf???"
269						);
270						self.in_code_block = false;
271						self.in_rust_code_block = false;
272						TagEnd::CodeBlock
273					},
274					// we don't need to modify any other tags
275					tag => tag
276				}),
277
278				Event::Text(text) if self.in_code_block && self.in_rust_code_block => {
279					let mut filtered = text
280						.lines()
281						.filter_map(|line| filter_hidden_rust_codeblock_lines(line))
282						.join("\n");
283					if filtered.is_empty() {
284						continue;
285					}
286					if text.ends_with('\n') {
287						filtered.push('\n');
288					}
289					Event::Text(filtered.into())
290				},
291
292				ev => ev
293			});
294		}
295	}
296}
297
298struct Readme<'a> {
299	template: &'a str,
300	input: &'a InputFile,
301
302	/// Holds the main markdown part of the readme that was created from the rustdoc,
303	/// but does not include any parts of the template or the links.
304	readme: String,
305
306	/// Holds the link part of the markdown.
307	readme_links: String,
308
309	links: BTreeMap<String, String>
310}
311
312impl<'a> Readme<'a> {
313	fn new(template: &'a str, input: &'a InputFile) -> Self {
314		Self {
315			template,
316			input,
317			readme: String::new(),
318			readme_links: String::new(),
319			links: BTreeMap::new()
320		}
321	}
322
323	fn write_markdown(&mut self) -> Result<(), pulldown_cmark_to_cmark::Error> {
324		// we need this broken link callback for the purpose of broken links being parsed as links
325		let mut broken_link_callback = broken_link_callback;
326		let parser = Parser::new_with_broken_link_callback(
327			&self.input.rustdoc,
328			Options::all(),
329			Some(&mut broken_link_callback)
330		);
331
332		let options = pulldown_cmark_to_cmark::Options {
333			code_block_token_count: 3,
334			..Default::default()
335		};
336		pulldown_cmark_to_cmark::cmark_with_options(
337			EventFilter::new(parser.into_iter(), &mut self.links),
338			&mut self.readme,
339			options
340		)?;
341
342		// we need to replace the links generated by pulldown-cmark-to-cmark with
343		// reference-style links
344		let mut i = 0;
345		while i < self.readme.len() {
346			let Some(idx) = self.readme[i ..].find("(__link") else {
347				break;
348			};
349			let idx = idx + i;
350			let Some(idx2) = self.readme[idx ..].find(')') else {
351				break;
352			};
353			let idx2 = idx2 + idx;
354			i = idx2;
355
356			self.readme.replace_range(idx ..= idx, "[");
357			self.readme.replace_range(idx2 ..= idx2, "]");
358		}
359
360		if !self.readme.ends_with('\n') {
361			self.readme.push('\n');
362		}
363
364		Ok(())
365	}
366
367	fn write_links(&mut self) {
368		let mut links = Links::new(self.template, &self.input.rustdoc);
369		for link in self.links.keys().map(|l| l.to_owned()).collect::<Vec<_>>() {
370			let mut href = self.links[&link].to_owned();
371			if href.starts_with('`') && href.ends_with('`') {
372				href = href[1 .. href.len() - 1].to_owned();
373			}
374			let href = self.input.scope.resolve(&self.input.crate_name, href);
375
376			if let Ok(path) = syn::parse_str::<Path>(&href.path) {
377				self.links
378					.insert(link, links.build_link(&path, href.link_type, self.input));
379			}
380		}
381
382		if !links.deps.is_empty() {
383			writeln!(
384				self.readme_links,
385				" [__cargo_doc2readme_dependencies_info]: {}",
386				links.deps.encode()
387			)
388			.unwrap();
389		}
390		for (name, href) in &self.links {
391			// unwrap: writing to a String never fails
392			writeln!(self.readme_links, " [{}]: {}", name, href).unwrap();
393		}
394	}
395}
396
397#[derive(Serialize)]
398struct TemplateContext<'a> {
399	#[serde(rename = "crate")]
400	krate: &'a str,
401	#[serde(rename = "crate_version")]
402	krate_version: &'a str,
403	target: TargetType,
404
405	repository: Option<&'a str>,
406	repository_host: Option<String>,
407
408	license: Option<&'a str>,
409	rust_version: Option<&'a Version>,
410
411	readme: String,
412	links: String
413}
414
415pub fn emit(
416	input: InputFile,
417	template: &str,
418	out_file: &mut dyn io::Write
419) -> anyhow::Result<()> {
420	let mut readme = Readme::new(template, &input);
421
422	// unwrap: This will never fail since we're only writing to a String.
423	// it is just inconvenient to write .unwrap() behind every single write!() invocation
424	readme.write_markdown().unwrap();
425
426	readme.write_links();
427
428	let repository = input.repository.as_deref();
429	let ctx = TemplateContext {
430		krate: &input.crate_name,
431		krate_version: &format!("{}", input.crate_version),
432		target: input.target_type,
433		repository,
434		repository_host: repository.and_then(|repo| {
435			let url = Url::parse(repo).ok();
436			url.as_ref()
437				.and_then(|url| url.host_str())
438				.map(String::from)
439		}),
440		license: input.license.as_deref(),
441		rust_version: input.rust_version.as_ref(),
442		readme: readme.readme,
443		links: readme.readme_links
444	};
445
446	let mut env = minijinja::Environment::new();
447	env.add_template("template", template)?;
448	env.get_template("template")?
449		.render_to_write(ctx, out_file)?;
450
451	Ok(())
452}
